Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Well, we survived the courtyard. But the alarm bells are still ringing.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: They know we're here. The front gates will be locked down tight.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: I'm open to suggestions that don't involve us being skewered.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: We have two ways out. The old stone bridge to the east, or the drainage sewers below.

Choices.Text: The bridge. I refuse to go into the sewers.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: The bridge. Definitely the bridge. I will not subject my silk shirt to raw sewage.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: The bridge is a choke point, you vanity-obsessed fool! Fine, but draw your blade.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: As much as it pains me... the sewers offer cover.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: A tactical choice. You might have a brain under that hair after all.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: See? The fresh air is lovely. A bit breezy, but manageable.

Steps.Speaker: Orc
Steps.Text: Puny men not cross bridge! Boss says smash!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: I told you it was a choke point! Brace yourself!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Two of them?! This feels excessive!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Aim for the knees, you idiot! Bring them down to our level!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: My arms are going to be sore for a week.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: We broke through. Let's keep moving before reinforcements arrive.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: The smell... It's like a tavern floor on a Sunday morning.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Quiet. The acoustics down here carry sound. We aren't alone.

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: Who's there? I got a crossbow pointed in the dark!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Watch your footing in the muck! Use the elevation!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: I'm burning these clothes as soon as we're out of here.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: You're alive to complain about it. The exit grate is just ahead.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: There it is. The perimeter gate. Freedom beckons!

Steps.Speaker: Orc
Steps.Text: Nobody leaves! Boss orders!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: A blockade. Typical. Draw steel, Ambrose. One last push!

Choices.Text: Let me handle the brute. You take the flank.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: I'll keep the big guy busy. You clear a path!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Don't get yourself killed, pretty boy.

Choices.Text: You take the big one. He's more your type.

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: He looks like he wants to wrestle. I leave that to you.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Coward. Stay out of my way, then.

Steps.Speaker: Guard
Steps.Text: Don't let them reach the treeline!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: I'm trying, but you keep standing in my way!

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: We're clear. Into the forest, now!

Steps.Speaker: Ambrose
Steps.Text: Finally. Let's hope the local fauna is friendlier than the guards.

Steps.Speaker: Dougal
Steps.Text: Keep your guard up. We still have a long walk to the safehouse.
